title: Yeah I deserve it, I wish their was context tho.
body:
First game was my most recent. Got shit on by Yasuo playing Kassadin and constantly ganked pre-6, got angry at jg for some reason, mb.

Game 1
In-Game
MuteAllForeverer: No one banned yi?
MuteAllForeverer: can i get a gank mid before I afk?
MuteAllForeverer: Bitch I will afk
MuteAllForeverer: Keep talking
MuteAllForeverer: nice gank
MuteAllForeverer: Bitch yi can do fine
MuteAllForeverer: Why cant you

MuteAllForeverer: Gank mid next time

MuteAllForeverer: I cant stay back under tower?
MuteAllForeverer: its yi
MuteAllForeverer: ganks
MuteAllForeverer: Want me to give him the kill next time?
MuteAllForeverer: Fine I will instead of the execute
MuteAllForeverer: under tower

MuteAllForeverer: again
MuteAllForeverer: Because Jg pressure is important

MuteAllForeverer: We are not winning top
MuteAllForeverer: We are losing top
MuteAllForeverer: both towers are gone
MuteAllForeverer: ???
MuteAllForeverer: It dont matter
MuteAllForeverer: its over
MuteAllForeverer: better jg wins
MuteAllForeverer: Now you want to help
MuteAllForeverer: at the inhib
MuteAllForeverer: gg xin
MuteAllForeverer: Now I have more kills than cait
MuteAllForeverer: Dead weight
MuteAllForeverer: adc
MuteAllForeverer: 1 kill

MuteAllForeverer: lul
MuteAllForeverer: you cant get one kill
MuteAllForeverer: 0 kills
MuteAllForeverer: why play?
Post-Game
MuteAllForeverer: 0 kills
MuteAllForeverer: why play adc?
MuteAllForeverer: He also didnt kill anyone with his easy lane
MuteAllForeverer: hmmmm
MuteAllForeverer: Still got more kills
MuteAllForeverer: Call me terrible but I still killed more than you
MuteAllForeverer: Yeah play safe when I get towered dived 3 times
MuteAllForeverer: More kills
MuteAllForeverer: More kills
MuteAllForeverer: Do you know how to kill?
MuteAllForeverer: M2
MuteAllForeverer: M2
MuteAllForeverer: M2
MuteAllForeverer: click that for kills
MuteAllForeverer: Keep talking
MuteAllForeverer: About your 0 kills
MuteAllForeverer: lul

MuteAllForeverer: Lul

Post-Game

MuteAllForeverer: look at the damage

replies.body:
Context for what? Your title hit it pretty square on the head-- you deserved it.
You were toxic and spamming chat with rude remarks and negativity.

Context for the guy who I was arguing with, the guy who's was saying hateful speech, telling me to die and suck his dick? 

Like I agree I was toxic, what I don't agree is the context it is taken without the other side of the story.

Also I don't like how I lost my temper for one game out of 100, and get banned for 14 days, but I still agree I was toxic.

How was I supposed to know that? You only provided your side of the chat. 
Context doesn't matter. You were toxic, you get punished.
If they really were acting like you say, hopefully they'll get punished as well.
But you're responsible for your own actions.

> [{quoted}](name=TheUrbanKitsune,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=b7iElVlz,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-10T01:05:11.573+0000)
>
> How was I supposed to know that? You only provided your side of the chat. 
> Context doesn't matter. You were toxic, you get punished.
> If they really were acting like you say, hopefully they'll get punished as well.
> But you're responsible for your own actions.

"How was I supposed to know that? You only provided your side of the chat."

"Context doesn't matter. You were toxic, you get punished."

How are you going to say that you didn't know that and I only provided my side of the chat then proceed to say context doesn't matter? Like wtf? Also, Riot doesn't provide context in chat logs.

"But you're responsible for your own actions."

You're beating a dead horse rn, It literally says in it in the title, I deserve it.

In terms of getting banned, context means nothing. You were toxic, deal with the consequences.
I was asking what you meant by wanting context--
You retorted to my comment by saying,

>"Context for the guy who I was arguing with, the guy who's was saying hateful speech, telling me to die and suck his dick?"

With a question mark at the end, as if I am supposed to be some omnipotent being that should know this information despite you saying nothing about it in your post.
Why even bother making this post and titling it, 'yeah, I deserve it' if all you're going to do is complain and argue with people who agree?
Hey you don't like the post and how I respond? Mute me and leave.

Alright, fair enough. Enjoy your free 2 week vacation! :D
I'm gonna go play League.
Same, I just made another account.

Technically you lost your temper for at least 3 games.  Did you already had a 10 and 25 game CR?  I skimmed through these logs and don't really see any ZT or anything that would escalate you so this must be your 3rd punishment.  I would say the bar for getting punished at your rung on the ladder is more than a little lower than someone who just received their first 10 CR (just like the bar for getting perma-ban after this 14 days is REALLY low compared to someone who just got 10 CR).

To be fair, I didn't say much in the 2nd and 3rd game, Its less than what Tarzaned says on a daily and they use it for the chat logs. Idk. 

I received the 25 game chat log, like 3 months ago at lvl 10. Look like the trend for me is being toxic for a 2-3 games every 3 months out of hundreds. 

Honestly, for how little I normally type in chat and How often I am not toxic, like 99% of the games I play. Its quite absurd that they take only 3 games into account out of hundreds. I normally mute all or turn off chat but you can't really coordinate for baron without chat. 1-3 games I lose my temper over 3 months justify's a 14 game ban. 

I don't know.

it's 3 SAMPLE games.  it is not necessary the only 3 games that got you punished.  Also, this 14-day is based on these 3 games + however many more not shown (that's why it's called a sample) + your previous 2 CR (I explained the low bar for punished above).

The only context that matters is whether you used chat to insult and harass others. 

Why you decided to insult / harass others doesn't matter.

So, it has come to this: someone displayed misbehavior in a LoL match in flagrant disregard for the game's rules, ToS, EULA, and Summoner's Code. That's unfortunate, and I'm sorry you had to deal with it. If this misbehavior happened in chat (including emotes or ping) and they don't respond positively to a _single, courteous, constructive request to focus on the game_, your best option is to mute that player. Submit a report after the match. This is equivalent to dealing with a noisy person in a library by asking them to keep it down and then notifying library staff and moving to another area.

_Do not respond with misbehavior of your own!_ If you do that, your teammates may mute and report _you_, and those reports would be valid. This is equivalent to dealing with a noisy person in a library by getting into a shouting match with them. Just because someone else started it doesn't justify you in continuing it. I'm sure you're familiar with the "s/he started it" trope, where two children get into an argument or fight and then try to claim innocence of any wrongdoing by claiming that they didn't instigate it. As any parent, teacher, or other supervisor of children will tell you, that excuse doesn't fly. When Dad is trying to drive you to Disneyland and your annoying brother starts making faces at you as he's previously been told not to, you should calmly ask him to stop, and then, if that doesn't work, calmly notify your parents of the problem. Making faces at him or shouting at him has never been a good way to get him to stop, and it makes you just as guilty of that as he.

Riot doesn't care who started it. Someone else's misbehavior does not justify your own.

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-):

> * Simply speaking, retaliation is not an acceptable or justifiable behavior. An argument between two players can easily create a negative experience for the rest of the players in the game with you. Regardless of the other player’s actions, this does not justify your own behavior. You alone are responsible for your actions within the game.If you encounter a toxic player like this, the best option is to simply report their behavior and move on.
> * Reports are a vital piece to the puzzle. If you are not sure of what sort of behavior is reportable take a look at the [Reporting a Player FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player)

If you misbehave but a teammate or opponent does or says something even worse, you should definitely report them after the match, just as someone reported you for your own misbehavior. Yes, that's certainly possible. Reports are not a limited resource. Any time someone believes that another player violated LoL's behavioral standards, they can report that player. Punishments are similarly not limited: if more than one player in a game merits a punishment, they can both get a punishment. This can happen even if the players in question were antagonizing each other. The IFS doesn't need to weigh the severity of all reported players' actions and then "award" the "winner" with a punishment; it's not a contest.

Think of it like dealing with a noisy person in a library: ask them to keep it down, and then notify library staff and move to another area if that doesn't work. If you get into a shouting match with them, you're just as likely to be removed, even if you weren't shouting _quite_ as loudly as they were. The goal is a quiet library.

The only chat messages included in your chat log are your own for a single, extremely good reason: they are the only ones taken into account for your punishment, because they're the only ones in your control. The things other players said and did in your match might produce in you an impulse to do certain things that may include breaking LoL's rules, but your behavior is your own, and you are responsible for it. If you really think about it, this is a good thing. If a toxic player's goading could exempt you from punishment for your flaming them, calling for reports, etc., then it would logically go the other way as well, resulting in punishments for players who didn't necessarily break any rules but weren't quite as friendly and positive as their teammates. Can you imagine a world where "didn't participate in the dance party and ignored all of our jokes" was a valid report that could get someone suspended for two weeks? We don't want that situation anymore than we want "called our support a braindead waste of space" to be considered an _invalid_ report just because, say, the support was telling their team to harm themselves while they merrily ran it down mid.

If your teammates had muted you at the first sign of your misbehavior, that would've minimized their exposure to it. However, the only people who wouldn't even see that first sign are those who /mute all at the start of every game. Everyone else would get that initial taste of your toxicity. The rules are intended to make chat _positive and useful_. If your presence means that anyone making the slightest effort to communicate in a team game has to deal with the sort of chat messages you've displayed here, that's on you, not on them. _Behave yourself._

You weren't punished for misbehaving in one game. You were punished for misbehaving in _one more_ game, in a consistent pattern of negative behavior that breaks the game's rules. Additionally, the reform card doesn't always show all the logs that led to your punishment: it randomly selects up to several logs. You might see three logs, but you also might see as few as one, even for players whose punishment stems not from a small number of egregious infractions but rather from dozens of instances of mild toxicity. The purpose of the reform card is to tell you how to reform, so it shows you an example of the behavior that prompted your punishment and explains that such behavior is inappropriate and should be avoided if you want to maintain an account in good standing.

I'm sorry you've seen worse, but the system wants your behavior to be _acceptable_, not just _less unacceptable_ than what you have seen in others.

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-):

> We have a zero-tolerance policy for extreme negative behavior as well as extremely offensive language and remarks made in game towards other players. Since it is a severe disregard for the Summoner’s Code this sort of behavior can result in skipping to a Two week or Permanent suspension. Suspensions of this degree based on negative behavior will not likely be reduced or removed.

Tldr; spent too much time in chat. If you look at other punishment posts you will see most of them make a lot of comments or they say one of riot's trigger words.

Kind of like a game of 21, a trigger words are 22, insults and threats are 4 and kindness is 0.
Lol context for spamming O's in chat? Hahaha. Let me guess, someone else was spamming so you spammed back? Yay context...
